output: For each test case, print the minimum number of operations needed to create the painting or -1 if it is impossible.
input:
The input contains several test cases. Each test case starts with one line containing four integers n, m, r and c. (1 ≤ r ≤ n ≤ 100, 1 ≤ c ≤ m ≤ 100), The following n lines each describe one row of pixels of the painting you want to create. The ith line consists of m characters describing the desired pixel values of the ith row in the finished painting ('0' indicates white, '1' indicates black).

                    The last test case is followed by a line containing four zeros.
name: Annoying Painting Tool
description:
Maybe you wonder what an annoying painting tool is? First of all, the painting tool we speak of supports only black and white. Therefore, a picture consists of a rectangular area of pixels, which are either black or white. Second, there is only one operation how to change the color of pixels:

                    Select a rectangular area of r rows and c columns of pixels, which is completely inside the picture. As a result of the operation, each pixel inside the selected rectangle changes its color (from black to white or from white to black).

                    Initially, all pixels are white. To create a picture, the operation described above can be applied several times. Can you paint a certain picture which you have in mind?
